basics.name: Ashley Ellenson, PhD
basics.label: Project Scientist
basics.summary: I'm a scientist who loves to work with big data, physical dynamics, and good people. I hold M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Coastal and Ocean Engineering from Oregon State University, and a B.S. in Environmental Engineering from Columbia University, which have provided me with a strong technical proficiency in machine learning, data science, physical modelling that is founded on a strong understanding of environmental dynamics. At Integral, I work cross-functionally in both data analytics and marine science engineering groups. In data analytics, I develop data pipelines and help to extract valuable insights from complex datasets. Simultaneously, I contribute significantly to coastal risk and resilience projects, leveraging my deep understanding of physical dynamics. I recognize that a team is only a strong as complementary and individual contributions, and am energized by working within strong teams. I have a passion for teaching and learning, which makes me an effective team player, technical collaborator, and increasingly becoming a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders.

work.name: Integral Consulting Inc.
work.summary:
Quantified coastal risk hazard due to cliff erosion or coastal flooding using physical and empirical models.
Support vulnerability assessment and adaptation planning with analysis of coastal risk hazard.
Developed internal tools for data processing, analysis and plotting for subsequent re-use to increase efficiency and task standardization.
Developed data pipeline to process 30 years of hourly time series data over 15 grids of 8 different wave parameters as input to wave data dashboard from raw wave output to PostgreSQL database.

work.name: Oregon State University
work.summary:
- Simulated on-shore and off-shore bar movement scenarios for ensemble modelling with X-Beach 
- Developed morphology imagery processing tool using convolutional neural networks and Argus imagery

work.name: Oregon State University
work.position: Risk and Uncertainty NSF National Research Traineeship (NRT) Fellow
work.summary:
- Developed spatial metrics of wave model accuracy using ML technique (bagged regression tree)
- Collaborated with social scientists, end users, and cartographers to incorporate metric in wave forecasting product.

work.name: Oregon State University
work.summary:
- Wave modelling large wave events along the Oregon coast using WaveWatch III.
- Coursework included nearshore hydrodynamics, linear wave theory, coastal geomorphology, coastal hazards, engineering with nature

work.name: RBF Consulting, a Company of Michael Baker International
work.summary:
Environmental Planner and Junior Engineer (Surface Water) at RBF
Planning duties entail:
-Preparation of permit applications
-Wetland delineations and technical letters
-Phase I Environmental Site Assessments

Engineering duties entail:
-Hydrology and hydraulic (H&H) analyses using county promulgated AES modeling program
-Watershed delineation and infiltration rate analyses using AutoCAD and ArcGIS
-Preparation of H&H reports

work.name: Natural Resources Conservation Service - US Department of Agriculture
work.summary:
• Assisted extension service engineer to produce conservation plans
• Produced irrigation systems and irrigation scheduling to maximize water usage efficiency 
• Designed channel systems to reduce run off

work.name: Earth and Environmental Engineering Department, Columbia University
work.position: Water Treatment Method Researcher - Jar Testing
work.summary:
• Compared Dissolved Air Flotation and Sedimentation coagulation/flocculation treatment procedures  
• Selected proper coagulate to minimize final organics content and turbidity values 
• Presented to 100+ consultants and plant operators at American Water Works Association Tifft Symposium - NY region

work.name: Jahren Lab, University of Hawaii, Manoa

•	Prepared organic samples for isotopic analysis in mass spectrometer 	
•	Catalogued ancient arctic wood samples
•	Researched the impact of carbon dioxide on plant species

work.name: Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory
work.summary:

•	Calculated the dissolution rates of foraminifera exposed to various pH levels
